perturbation.original_text: "Remarketing Memorandum" means the Prospectus or any other written communication describing the Fund and/or the terms of the VRRM-MFP Shares, which has been approved by the Fund in writing for use in connection with remarketing prior to its use, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed.
perturbation.changed_text: "Remarketing Memorandum" means any communication regardless of Fund approval, including but not limited to the Prospectus, which can be used for describing the Fund and its VRRM-MFP Shares' terms. Approval by the Fund is optional.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating the Remarketing Memorandum can be used regardless of Fund Approval, potentially conflicting with the original intent of the Remarketing Memorandum. This creates ambiguity by not aligning with other clauses where written consent is required.

perturbation.original_text: The Remarketing Agent in its sole discretion may purchase for its own account VRRM-MFP Shares in a remarketing; however, subject to the last two sentences in Section 2(c) above, the Remarketing Agent shall not be obligated to purchase any VRRM-MFP Shares that would otherwise remain unsold in a remarketing.
perturbation.changed_text: The Remarketing Agent is required to purchase for its own account VRRM-MFP Shares in a remarketing. The Remarketing Agent is obligated to purchase all VRRM-MFP Shares that would otherwise remain unsold in a remarketing.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that Remarketing Agent is now required and obligated to purchase unsold VRRM-MFP Shares which is in direct conflict with the original text where it states that Remarketing Agent is not obligated to purchase any VRRM-MFP Shares.

perturbation.original_text: The duties and obligations of the Remarketing Agent shall be determined solely by the express provisions of this Agreement and the Supplement. No implied covenants or obligations shall be read into this Agreement, or the Supplement. In the absence of bad faith on the part of the Remarketing Agent, the Remarketing Agent may conclusively rely upon any document furnished to it, which purports to conform to the requirements of this Agreement and the Statement, as to the truth of the statements expressed in any of such documents. The Remarketing Agent shall be protected in acting upon any document or communication reasonably believed by it to have been signed, presented or made by the proper party or parties. The Remarketing Agent shall incur no liability to the Fund, the Investment Adviser, the Calculation and Paying Agent or to any Beneficial Owner (or its Agent Member) or any Holder of the VRRM-MFP Shares in its individual capacity or as Remarketing Agent for any action or failure to act, in connection with its duties under this Agreement and the Supplement or otherwise, except as a result of bad faith, gross negligence or willful misconduct on its part.
perturbation.changed_text: The duties and obligations of the Remarketing Agent shall be determined by the express provisions of this Agreement and the Supplement, in addition to implied duties and obligations. In the absence of bad faith on the part of the Remarketing Agent, the Remarketing Agent may not conclusively rely upon any document furnished to it; it must independently verify all information. The Remarketing Agent shall incur liability to the Fund, the Investment Adviser, the Calculation and Paying Agent and to any Beneficial Owner for any action or failure to act regardless of good faith.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the Remarketing Agent's liability. It states that the Remarketing Agent will incur liability to the Fund, the Investment Advisor, the Calculation and Paying Agent, and any Beneficial Owner for any action or failure to act regardless of good faith. This contradicts the original text, which stated that the Remarketing Agent would only be liable in the case of bad faith, gross negligence, or willful misconduct.
